intro: Hieracium kerneri subsp. amoenohastatum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette or alternate fashion, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
